newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares open weak, Delifrance shines.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares open weak, Delifrance shines.

text.p: Singapore shares opened weak on Monday as the foreign tranches of many blue-chip counters came under pressure, while buying interest was focused on new issues.
The benchmark Straits Times Industrials Index was down 10.62 points at 0210 GMT to 2,053.90 points. Turnover was 40.07 million shares with gainers ahead of losers 60 to 48.

Delifrance Asia, which made its debut on Monday, led the actives, opening sharply above its offer price of Singapore $0.78 and trading to a high of S$0.965. It was at S$0.935 at 0214 GMT on active volume of 13.9 million shares.
"The talk is about it reaching S$1.00. There's a lot of institutional interest in the stock," said a dealer.
Labroy Marine continued to see interest after some late buying by syndicates on Friday lifted it from a flat debut, said a dealer at a local brokerage.

The foreign tranches of DBS, Fraser & Neave and SIA Ltd headed the losers, shedding between S$0.40 and S$0.20. Malaysian over-the-counter shares such as Samanda Holdings and Land & General dominated the gainers.
Dealers said Singapore's trade data, due at midday, were unlikely to have much impact as the market had discounted a decline of 3-4 percent in non-oil exports for September.
